[X_SEP] in the video , twisting groups of magnetic fields writhe around a central axis , and the rope ultimately causes a bright flash - a solar flare - to form . [X_SEP] it is hoped the study , which shows a flux rope in unprecedented detail , could help increase understanding on how they form .

[X_SEP] a surgeon first implants a small silicon chip with 150 electrodes on the retina . [X_SEP] when the patient puts on the system ' s dark glasses , an integrated video camera sends images to a portable computer . [X_SEP] copper inside melted , indicating temperatures of at least 1 , 085 c ( 1 , 985 f ) , and it caused molten material to stream from the vent . [X_SEP] this is the first time the failure of batteries due to overheating has been recorded . [X_SEP] during tests , one cell remained intact during battery failure . researchers at stanford university school of medicine believe the laboratory - engineered antibodies could eradicate both primary tumours and distant metastases . [X_SEP] process relies on the same mechanism as that which causes animals ' bodies to reject organ transplants . [X_SEP] antibodies bind themselves to proteins from the foreign tissue , and through the use of signalling cells , alert t - cells , that act like the immune system ' s swat team . [X_SEP] mice injected with the antibodies remained cancer - free for more than a year .

the finding was made by scientists at haverford college in pennsylvania , us using nasa ' s nustar telescope . [X_SEP] when they peered at the galactic centre , they found an emission of x - rays that corresponded to thousands of dead stars being present . [X_SEP] the emission could also be due to millisecond pulsars - rapidly rotating neutron stars - or dense magnetic fields . [X_SEP] all three planets in the system orbit the star , hd 7924 , at a distance closer than mercury orbits the sun , completing their orbits in just 5 , 15 and 24 days . [X_SEP] they then used artificial neural networks to compare the sober and drunken images pixel - by - pixel . [X_SEP] the scientists found that the temperature of the forehead and to a lesser extent , the nose , is the best indication of a person ' s drunken state . [X_SEP] this removes the need to specialist hardware such as fingerprint readers or infrared cameras . salt card was created by joel paglione and niko zistakis in chicago . [X_SEP] they claim it will save people around 53 hours over a year , based on the belief that the average phone user unlocks their phone 150 times a day . [X_SEP] the credit card - sized gadget also locks devices again as soon as a user moves out of range at a distance of 10 feet ( three metres ) . [X_SEP] it connects to an app on a user ' s android handset or iphone via bluetooth .

[X_SEP] frequent landslides reveal new ones , some of which belong to unknown species . [X_SEP] the wall , which is the largest dinosaur trackway in the world , is approximately 390 feet ( 120 metres ) tall and features tracks made by at least eight species of dinosaurs . [X_SEP] in 2009 , fossil hunters came across what are thought to be among the world ' s largest dinosaur prints .

' marilyn einstein ' was created by superimposing a blurry picture of marilyn monroe over a picture of albert einstein drawn in fine lines . [X_SEP] at normal screen viewing distance you should see the face of einstein . [X_SEP] features with a high spatial frequency ( einstein ) are only visible when you ' re viewing them close up , and those with low spatial frequencies ( monroe ) is only visible from further away . [X_SEP] combining pictures of the two produces a single image which changes when the viewer moves closer or farther away from the screen .

gibbons produce soft ' hoo ' calls that are almost inaudible to the human ear . [X_SEP] yet scientists have found the animals use these whispers to communicate specific information to each other about predators , foraging and when meeting neighbours . [X_SEP] predator ' hoos ' in particular were produced at frequencies well below the threshold of hearing for eagles and other birds of prey . [X_SEP] this suggests the quiet calls were designed to alert other gibbons nearby without alerting the raptors . [X_SEP] a dictionary that decodes the calls produced by gibbons is being developed by scientists .

[X_SEP] the phenomenon is fairly common and the number of spots on the solar surface reflects with how active the sun is . [X_SEP] sun spots range in size , from just 10 miles ( 16km ) to 100 , 000 miles ( 160 , 000 km ) wide - big enough to be seen from earth . [X_SEP] each one can be more than ten times the size of our planet .

ephedra foeminea waits for the full moon to ' bloom ' and is the only plant species so far that ' s known to behave in this way . [X_SEP] at night , the non - flowering relative of conifers secretes tiny droplets of sugary fluid to attract pollinating insects . [X_SEP] they ooze from the plant ' s female organs where seeds are produced . [X_SEP] when a nocturnal butterfly or insect lands on one of the globules , the pollen it ' s carrying is used to fertilise the seed .

[X_SEP] it was not until 7 , 800 years ago , when the first farmers migrated from the near east through turkey , that two key genes that provide lighter skin appeared . [X_SEP] one of these genes became prevalent in the european population and the other , which makes skin colour lighter still , also began to spread . [X_SEP] the research suggests caucasians were a recent addition to the continent , arriving 8 , 000 years ago .

[X_SEP] they can be fighting enemies , or fleeing danger , and actually act out these dreams in their beds . [X_SEP] people with rbd physically move limbs or even get up and engage in activities associated with waking . [X_SEP] this can range from making small hand movements to thrashing around , punching , kicking and jumping out of bed .

[X_SEP] scientists believe these earthquakes were the result of high - pressure injection of drilling wastewater into the ground . [X_SEP] oil and gas industry uses injection wells to get rid of wastewater , which can have chemicals , heavy metals , salt and radioactive material . [X_SEP] timing and location of the quakes correlates better to the drilling and injection than any other possible reason .

[X_SEP] studies have shown that sleep is critical in converting short - term memories , into long - term memory , a process known as memory consolidation . [X_SEP] but just how that process works has remained a mystery . scientists have found vast deep water gas hydrates in the arctic . [X_SEP] they are reservoirs for abiotic methane , a form of the deadly gas . [X_SEP] methane is 20 times more effective in trapping heat than carbon dioxide . [X_SEP] the gas forms through a process called serpentinisation . [X_SEP] it occurs when seawater reacts with hot mantle rocks exhumed . [X_SEP] scientists don ' t believe the formations will impact climate change . [X_SEP] instead , they say similar formations could someday be used to store methane , that can later be used as fuel .

biologists at the hebrew university of jerusalem studied octopuses . [X_SEP] they found that the orientation of the creature ' s body and the crawling direction are controlled independently in the brain . [X_SEP] the thrust comes from arms that push by elongation rather than arms that pull . [X_SEP] this combined with the symmetrical arrangement of the arms around the body helps to give the octopus its extraordinary maneuverability . [X_SEP] findings may help scientists develop new ways for soft robots to move .

the modular robotic vehicle , or mrv , was developed at nasa ' s johnson space center to show off the technologies that could let man move across other planets . [X_SEP] unlike a normal car , the buggy has no mechanical linkages to the propulsion , steering , or brake actuators , the driver relies completely on electrical signals . [X_SEP] a turn of the steering wheel is recorded by sensors and sent to computers at the rear of the vehicle , which then instruct motors at one or all four of the wheels to move at the appropriate rate .

archaeologists at boston university and the university of bath used a computer model to calculate how much energy neanderthals had without cooking their food . [X_SEP] they found that without fire , a group of neanderanders would have had less energy - the equivalent 12 reindeer a year - than if they did . [X_SEP] this would have meant they lost out when modern humans arrived from africa . [X_SEP] modern humans who regularly cooked their food could then channel this extra energy into growing their population and searching longer for food .

researchers at the university of huddersfield have created a technique which they claim can distinguish between the genetic fingerprints of identical twins . [X_SEP] identical twins start life with the same genes because they come from the same fertilised egg which divides into two embryos . [X_SEP] but as they age different life experiences , such as smoking or diet , create variations in the number of hydrogen bonds in the dna . [X_SEP] using a technique called high resolution melt curve analysis - or hrma - researchers can now identify the difference between each twin .

the moai are monolithic human figures carved by the rapa nui people on easter island , between 1 , 250 and 1 , 500 ad . [X_SEP] some 1 , 000 carved moai line the perimeter of the 12 mile ( 25km ) volcanic island , which is the most isolated inhabited landmass on earth with just 6 , 000 residents . [X_SEP] physicists believe the hats , or ' pukao ' , were rolled up ramps to reach the top of the figures which measure up to 40ft ( 12 metres ) tall .

[X_SEP] experts were able to convert lips into petals in two orchid species by reducing the activity of the l complex using gene silencing .

[X_SEP] the areas are the amazon , the atlantic forest and gran chaco , and the cerrado in south america , the congo basin , east africa , eastern australia and borneo . [X_SEP] they are home to indigenous communities that depend on forest for their livelihoods and endangered species such as orangutans and tigers . [X_SEP] but they are being lost to expanding agriculture , including livestock farming , palm oil plantations and soy production
